alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; East Platte County; North Laramie Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 7:28PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Albany and west central Platte Counties through 800 PM MDT... At 728 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southeast of Harris Park, or 18 miles northwest of Wheatland, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Albany and west central Platte Counties. This includes Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 86 and 97. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; East Platte County; North Laramie Range
